formattedAddress: 50 E 57th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 50 E 57th St, New York, NY 10022, USA

editorialSummary.text: Traditional shirt shop selling British-made bespoke & ready-to-wear shirts & ties.

originalText.text: Always friendly and superb service. Beautiful suites, that simply fits perfect and an excellent selection of smart casual wear. My husband swears by their quality and expertise. Even our teenage daughter had a lovely experience buying something so simple as socks for a Father’s Day present. Would give them 10⭐️ If possible.

text.text: Always friendly and superb service. Beautiful suites, that simply fits perfect and an excellent selection of smart casual wear. My husband swears by their quality and expertise. Even our teenage daughter had a lovely experience buying something so simple as socks for a Father’s Day present. Would give them 10⭐️ If possible.

originalText.text: Went into store asking to purchase a briefcase that was made in England.  Never have been treated so poorly in a retail store. Pompous,arrogant staff,both men there had no interest in selling anything and were unable or unwilling too offer information on either of the British brands Ettinger or Bennet Winch.  They might as well have been working at a Burger king. So I ordered a brilliant England made briefcase from Swaine Adeney in London instead. Cannot understand why Turnbull and Asser would hire these two gentlemen,but thanks because I. Love my new Swaine Adeney business case.  I must also say that you would be hard pressed to have a retail store that makes you less likely to spend any $ there than Turnbull and Asser. Two vainglorious men who should be in search of employment in a stock room someplace where their horrible demeanor will not scare away prospective clients

originalText.text: The price might come as a shock at first, but you pay for the quality and artistry that goes into each shirt.  Customer service here is impeccable. Definitely worth a  visit if you are in the area.

text.text: The price might come as a shock at first, but you pay for the quality and artistry that goes into each shirt.  Customer service here is impeccable. Definitely worth a  visit if you are in the area.

originalText.text: Why love this place? Bond did for starters. It's a classic menswear joint with an incredible staff. Treat yourself to a pair of proper pajamas or a tie. You won't regret it.

text.text: Why love this place? Bond did for starters. It's a classic menswear joint with an incredible staff. Treat yourself to a pair of proper pajamas or a tie. You won't regret it.

originalText.text: With the Royal warrant from the Prince of Wales, Turbull and Asser is for the gentleman with impeccable taste. This three floor menswear boutique has it all. The once called history room is now turned comfortable seating room, is immediately seen as one walks in to the store. Tons of cashmere on the first floor. Pictures of notable clients are on the walls of the staircases. Turnbull and Asser is one of few which still offers hosiery in different sizes, four to be exact. Turnbull and Asser does full bespoke shirts, ties and umbrellas. Turnbull and Asser is also known for their sleepwear found in silk, cotton velvet and hand printed silk. A wall decorated with buttons and a robe encased in glass honoring Winston Churchill are on the third floor of the boutique. The third floor also has a chic formal wear room with notable cotton velvet smoking jacket. Memorable full bespoke room on the third floor offers customizable leather gloves, belts and umbrellas. Sales associates are personable and knowledgable. Turnbull and Asser is an exquisite menswear boutique.
